item.title: 'Jeopardy!' Whiz Ends 74-Game Win Streak (AP)
item.description: AP - Following his remarkable run as the "Jeopardy!" whiz, Ken Jennings is famous enough to be trailed by a fan in the subway, is penning a book and, of course, has $2,520,700 in winnings to decide how to spend.

item.title: Olympians on Hand for Tree Lighting (AP)
item.description: AP - A bright symbol of the holiday burst to life in Rockefeller Center Tuesday night as Mayor Michael Bloomberg and three Olympians turned on the 30,000 lights decorating the center's famed Christmas tree.

item.title: Hanks, Howard Reunite for 'Da Vinci Code' (AP)
item.description: AP - Tom Hanks will reunite with director Ron Howard to star in "The Da Vinci Code," the film adaptation of Dan Brown's best seller dissecting the origins of Christianity.

item.title: Man Acquitted of Stalking Sheryl Crow (AP)
item.description: AP - A love-struck fan who ardently pursued singer Sheryl Crow for 15 months was acquitted Tuesday of stalking her. A jury deliberated about three hours before finding Ambrose Kappos, 38, not guilty of burglary and stalking charges. He faced up to seven years in prison if convicted.

item.title: Ex-Nanny Sues Radio Personality Don Imus (AP)
item.description: AP - A former nanny who worked for Don Imus has sued the radio and television personality, claiming he wrongfully fired her, chased her off his New Mexico ranch in the middle of the night, and then trashed her on his radio show.

item.title: Sundance Brings Out the Stars in Premiere Movies (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - The Sundance Film Festival on Tuesday named dozens of films featuring stars from Sandra Bullock to "007" Pierce Brosnan that will premiere in January at what has become the leading U.S. showplace for independent movies.

item.title: Pavarotti to Retire After 40-City Tour (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Luciano Pavarotti, whose effortless tenor voice and powerful stage presence dominated opera for decades, plans to bow out like a superstar with a 40-city tour that will end with his retirement.

item.title: 'Jeopardy!' Whiz Ends 74-Game Win Streak (AP)
item.description: AP - Following his remarkable run as the "Jeopardy!" whiz, Ken Jennings is famous enough to be trailed by a fan in the subway, is penning a book and, of course, has $2,520,700 in winnings to decide how to spend.

item.title: New Gadgets Changing Face of Showbiz -- Study (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Most showbiz executives surveyed in a new poll believe that broadcast television networks are poorly positioned to compete with digital video recorders and other new technologies.

item.title: Paquin and Culkin Set for Kinney-Directed 'After Ashley' Off-Broadway (Playbill)
item.description: Playbill - Terry Kinney will direct Anna Paquin, Kieran Culkin and Tim Hopper in the upcoming Vineyard Theatre's Off-Broadway staging of Gina Gionfriddo's Humana Festival hit, After Ashley.

item.title: WARM UP TO ASIAN LIBATION (PageSix)
item.description: PageSix - SAKE is often described as "rice wine" but it is actually more like a beer. The drink is brewed and fermented in a manner similar to beer.

item.title: TV Review: Project Runaway (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - It's come to this: a reality series geared to create the next great fashion designer from the network (Bravo) that brought us "Queer Eye for the Straight Guy."

item.title: Prolific Canadian writer Pierre Berton dies, age 84 (AFP)
item.description: AFP - The popular Canadian writer Pierre Berton died of heart failure in a Toronto hospital at age 84, CBC television reported.
